Articles.Content:
Named after a film, the Polar Express is, similar to the traverser HOCgaming is using on his charity:water livestream (whcih can be found here), a rover intended on driving to the north pole of kerbin. It can support 4 kerbals - two in a capsule, two in external seats. It has afterburners, which are powered by mono-propellant and liquid fuel, which can boost it's speed in excess of 50m/s, with a normal speed of ~23.5m/s.

Harv, if you're reading this, this is a challenge - I am racing you to the north pole. This friendly challenge (which doesn't involve hi-jacking your stream) is my entry for a race to the north pole - going by in-game time (I probably won't be able to beat you to the north pole today). Here are a few screenshots:

Of course, I'll be adding updates every sunrise and sunset on kerbin to show you my progress. May the best man win, Harv!

End of day 1:

I have gone about a quarter of the way there during the kerbal day. The issue is is that, now it's becoming dark, and I'm in 'the death valley', I can either risk it and drive in the night, or just sleep through the night and continue in the morning... Driving in the night will give me a boost in the in-game time, but there is a strong chance of explosions everywhere... I'll be driving in the night.

Edited August 10, 2014 by TJPrime
